newsitem.title: USA: North American bunkers mixed, picks up in LA.
newsitem.headline: North American bunkers mixed, picks up in LA.

text.p: North American bunker prices were mixed early this week with the East Coast slightly lower and the West Coast picking up pace following a long slumber.
Players said the East Coast got off to a slow start following the long Easter holiday weekend, in line with softer crude oil futures.
In the Gulf Coast, Houston 380 CST was down about $2 a tonne to between $92 a tonne and $93 a tonne. 180 CST was down $3 to $95/96.
New York Harbor product on the East Coast stayed largely steady, with 380 CST at $93/95.
